titleStmt.title: An ansvver to the two fyrst and principall treatises of a certaine factious libell, put foorth latelie, without name of author or printer, and without approbation by authoritie, vnder the title of An abstract of certeine acts of Parlement: of certaine hir Maiesties iniuctions: of certaine canons, &c. Published by authoritie.
titleStmt.author: Cosin, Richard, 1549?-1597.
Stoughton, William, fl. 1584. Abstract, of certain acts of parliament.

notesStmt.note: Signatures: A-E ² A-P ³A-B ³C⁴ ³D² Q-Y 2A.

"An abstract, of certaine acts of Parlement: of certaine her Maiesties iniunctions: of certaine canons, constitutions, and synodals prouinciall ..", a partial reprint of the work attributed to William Stoughton (STC 10394), has separate title page and register; it is usually found preceding the Answer. "Dispensations for many benefices vnlavvful" (caption title) has separate register; it is usually bound between quires P and Q. The collation above reflects an order in which the "Abstract" precedes the "Answer".
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
A possibly printed by [J. Wolfe?]--cf. STC.
